description.narrative:
The goal of Australia’s development assistance to Afghanistan, as stated in its Development Assistance Framework (2007-2010), is to assist the Afghan Government and people to achieve a secure, stable, self sustaining democratic Afghan state. The focus of WoG assistance is in the southern province of Oruzgan, where the central government struggles for recognition of legitimacy.
The ADF Reconstruction Task Force deliver high quality development outcomes in a complex and challenging political, economic and security environment. Channelling support through the RTF is an efficient and effective mechanism for AusAID to deliver aid to this region.
This spending proposal will complement a variety of ADF activities such as the RTF Trade Training School (TTS) which has been delivering training for local students in carpentry, plumbing and allied trades for over 12 months. Over 250 students have graduated from the school, many of whom have now secured employment with local contracting comp
